title: 4 Easy Ways to Connect Your Computer and Phone

steps.title: Connect your phone to a USB port on your computer.
steps.content: Connect your phone to a USB port on your computer. You can use the USB charging cable that comes with your phone. Connect it to your phone and then connect the other end of the charging cable to a free USB port on your computer. For best results, connect your phone to a USB 3.0 or SuperSpeed port on your computer.

steps.title: Allow your phone to access your computer.
steps.content: Allow your phone to access your computer. You may see a prompt on your phone screen asking you to allow your computer to have access to your phone. Tap Allow or Trust this PC if prompted.

steps.title: Click the notification on your computer.
steps.content: Click the notification on your computer. If you see a notification above the taskbar in the lower-right corner that your phone is connected and has options, click on it. This displays options for your phone. You can also access your phone's internal storage using File Explorer on Windows or the Finder on Mac.

steps.title: Click the option most relevant to you.
steps.content: Click the option most relevant to you. This will connect your phone to your computer. The options are as follows: Import photos and videos - Store your camera roll items on your computer. Open device to view files - This opens your phone's external storage as a removable drive in File Explorer. Take no action - Ignore the device. Your PC may continue to charge your phone if you select this option.

steps.title: Download Link to Windows app on your phone.
steps.content: Download Link to Windows app on your phone. Phone Link is the official app from Microsoft that you can use to connect your phone to your computer wirelessly. Link to Windows is the companion app you download to your mobile phone. You can download it for free from the Google Play Store on Android devices or the App Store on iPhone or iPad .

steps.title: Open Phone Link on your PC.
steps.content: Open Phone Link on your PC. Phone Link usually comes pre-installed on Windows computers. Use the search bar to search "Phone Link" and open the Phone Link app in the Windows Start menu. If you don't have Phone Link installed on your Windows computer, you can download and install it for free from the Microsoft Store.

steps.title: Open the Link to Windows app on your phone.
steps.content: Open the Link to Windows app on your phone. It has a blue icon that resembles a smartphone in front of a laptop. Tap the Link to Windows app on your Home screen or Apps menu.

steps.title: Sign in to your Microsoft account.
steps.content: Sign in to your Microsoft account. You'll need to sign in to your Microsoft account on your mobile phone. Be sure to sign in to the same Microsoft account you use on your Windows computer.

steps.title: Scan the QR code on your PC with your phone.
steps.content: Scan the QR code on your PC with your phone. Use the following steps to display the QR code on your computer screen and scan it with your phone: Click the I have the Link to Windows app ready checkbox in the Phone Link app on your computer. Click Scan QR code Tap Link your phone and PC in the Link to Windows app on your smartphone. Tap Continue when asked if the QR code is ready. Tap Allow if asked to allow the app to use your camera. Scan the QR code on your computer screen.

steps.title: Allow all permissions on your phone.
steps.content: Allow all permissions on your phone. The Link to Windows app will ask you to allow various other permissions, such as access to your contacts, notifications, phone, and more. Tap Allow for any permissions the app asks.

steps.title: Use the Phone Link app to access your phone on your computer.
steps.content: Use the Phone Link app to access your phone on your computer. You can use the Phone Link app to view your phone notifications, messages, photos, and apps on your computer. You can also make calls on your computer if you set up the dialer. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To set up to dialer, click the Calls tab at the top of the Phone Link app. Then click Get Started . Follow the instructions to set up calls on your computer.

steps.title: Download and install the Apple Devices app.
steps.content: Download and install the Apple Devices app. The Apple Devices app allows you to sync your files, photos, movies, TV shows, podcasts, and music with your iPhone and Windows computer as well as transfer files from your iPhone to your PC and vice versa. You can download and install the Apple Devices app from the Microsoft Store. Use the following steps to do so: Open the Microsoft Store . Search "Apple Devices" in the menu at the top and press Enter . Click Get to install the app.

steps.title: Open Apple Devices.
steps.content: Open Apple Devices. It has a blue icon with two circular arrows. Click the Apple Devices in your Windows Start menu. Alternatively, you can use iTunes for the time being. However, iTunes is being broken up into four different apps: Apple Music for music, Apple TV for movies and TV shows, iTunes for audiobooks and podcasts, and Apple Devices to connect and sync your phone with your computer. steps.title: Connect your iPhone to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iPhone to your computer. Use the USB or lightning cable that came with your iPhone to connect it to a free USB port on your PC.

steps.title: Select your iPhone.
steps.content: Select your iPhone. It'll be listed in the sidebar to the left. Select your iPhone from the drop-down menu at the top.

steps.title: Sync your media content.
steps.content: Sync your media content. To sync your media content, select the type of content you want to sync in the menu to the left. Then click the checkbox next to "Sync [media type] onto [iPhone name]." Then click Apply . Repeat for all media types you want to sync. Click Sync in the lower-right corner to sync your devices. To sync your music, you need to download and install the Apple Music app. To sync your movies and TV shows, you need to install the Apple TV app. If you click on Photos and it tells you your phone is using iCloud, this means your photos are already synced automatically to your iCloud drive. You'll need to access them on your iCloud drive .

steps.title: Transfer files between your iPhone and your computer.
steps.content: Transfer files between your iPhone and your computer. If you want to transfer files between your iPhone and your PC, use the following steps to do so: [3] X Research source Click Files in the menu bar to the left. Drag and drop a file to an app in the list to transfer it to your iPhone. Select a file and click Save . Then select a destination to save the file to save a file from your iPhone to your computer. Select a file and press Delete to delete the file.

steps.title: Click your computer's "Action Center" icon.
steps.content: Click your computer's "Action Center" icon. This is the square icon in the bottom right corner of your screen. It usually has the Wi-Fi and speaker icon. You can also hold the Windows key and tap A to open the Action Center.

steps.title: Click the Bluetooth icon .
steps.content: Click the Bluetooth icon . It's the icon that resembles a jagged "B" with a tail. This will turn on Bluetooth. If the icon is highlighted, Bluetooth is already on. You can skip this step.

steps.title: Open your phone's Quick Access or Control Center.
steps.content: Open your phone's Quick Access or Control Center. To do so on Android, swipe down from the top of the screen to open the Quick Access menu. On iPhone and iPad, swipe down from the upper-right corner to open the Control Center

steps.title: Turn on your phone's Bluetooth.
steps.content: Turn on your phone's Bluetooth. Tap the Bluetooth icon in the Quick Access or Control Center to toggle Bluetooth on or off.

steps.title: Click next to the Bluetooth icon.
steps.content: Click next to the Bluetooth icon. This is next to the Bluetooth icon in the Action Center window on Windows. This displays nearby devices you can pair with.

steps.title: Click your smartphone.
steps.content: Click your smartphone. This should connect your smartphone to your computer. Your computer's Bluetooth menu should go from listing your device as "Paired" to "Connected". Alternatively, you can tap and hold the Bluetooth icon on your mobile phone and tap your computer in the list of devices. If this doesn't work within a few seconds, click the On switch below "Bluetooth", then click it again.

steps.title: Exit the Bluetooth menu.
steps.content: Exit the Bluetooth menu. Your phone is now connected to your PC! Depending on your phone model, you'll be able to do anything from synchronizing your files to playing music through your computer's speakers.
